channel.title: The block has struck hard
channel.description:
Tornait here
Ever since the update dropped I’ve been looking at all the old stuff, and now I just look at it and don’t know what to do with it. Same thing with making new stuff. I have made a grand total of six new projects the past week and a half and have not gotten anywhere past a chorus yet.
Also, I think focusing on a new brand set messed me up in the fact that now my musical side has basically stabbed itself in the stomach and is now comatose. In simpler terms, I’ve got another block.
I need help please
Edit: I really need help with song structure and stuff, because none of my songs really have proper structure. **none** of them.

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
Hey guys… thanks for your support. I just uploaded a new track, one I’ve been working on for the past few days. Still feel like I have a few problems with my musical discipline, but I do feel much better now.

Shift Gears by Tornait (electro house/edm)

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: Matik
item.description:
Hmm, song structure for me is just using triplets and fourth chords. Like, C, E, and G. And drop a B for a seventh. Then from there you can move it almost anywhere and it’ll sound future-y!

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: TXA
item.description:
I know. Thanks for the advice

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: Little_Baby
item.description:
Try making a song 100% inspired from one you really like whether it be your own or not, and when you get to a certain point, drop that 100% inspiration and trail off.

Try doing something you haven’t done before, try new drums, different styles of melodies, different key signatures and tempos, different sound, try using ways of automation you usually don’t use to make a new sound.

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: BALLISTIK
item.description:
Finishing My Music Production Talk
Over the years, I’ve written hundreds of jams in Auxy, Logic Pro X, Garageband for iOS, and a few other places. I say “written” because, with a few exceptions, NOT A SINGLE ONE of them is finished. And in order for me to make any progress in the musical world, that has got to end soon. Here’s my theory on why this is the case: I sit down, possibly with nothing in my head, perhaps with a fully formed track in there. I start writing, recording, editing, etc, and soon I’ve got the beginnings o…

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
Wow… that feels so backwards to me. I start with a hook, build out to either a chorus or a verse, then build outwards from there.

Might give your method a go at some point just to see how it works out and to see if it inspires any new ideas

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: Pinewoodog
item.description:
Intro
Verse 1
Buildup
Drop 1
Bridge
Verse 2
Buildup
Drop 2
Outro

I (usually) create in this order: Make the drops, then the buildups, then the verses, then intro and outro last. But really, compose in whatever order you’re most comfortable.

If you have vocals, put them in the Verses/Intro/Outro

Good luck!

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Try this…
One track, one week

Don’t stress about getting tracks out there as soon as possible, or making a load of projects. Take your time and really put all your ideas into your project, and work as much quality into the track as possible.

Try this and make an amazing track

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
If I ever find myself low on inspiration I often use my studio time to make + organise my samples or to work on some new synth presets.

More often than not it tends to lead to a new idea!

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Don’t beat yourself up over it. Producing is ebb and flow. Sometimes I’ll hammer out three tracks in a week or two. Sometimes I’ll go weeks, months, with nothing.

Inspiration will strike. It might not happen as quick as you’d like, but an idea is gonna worm its way into your brain and you’ll make it happen

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
A tip for you my friend is to push urself to complete it! Be sure not to just keep replaying it and going “I don’t know what to do here”

You must stick to the songs flow and keep going with it!

If you want help with structuring here is a video of mine:

https://www.youtube.com/embed/36wwNNqGfvo

And here are some tips on music production and how to pursue in music production:

https://www.youtube.com/embed/ElM_J4210hY

Read full topic

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
lol meanwhile i’ve been doodling around with the same 5 or 6 projects for about 2-3 months now. I should release them, but every time i go for a listen im like “yo i should change this” and i either do or just put it off till next time.
So i’m pretty much just sitting on a bunch of 80-90% done tracks and havent worked on them for a while
(but since the update, its been forcing me to work on them some more b/c no subscription = no drums so…)

item.title: The block has struck hard
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
I will reiterate my point about listening to other people’s music. The best way to learn is by example, so find good examples of good song structure as you say, observe it actively, and try to replicate it.

item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
Everybody says this to me and I’ve done it, but now I just feel content to listen to their music over and over again and not actually have anything meaningful done about it.

In fact, I’ve just been listening to my stuff over and over again, not actually having the drive to get something done.
